reporting-org.narrative: Flemish Interuniversity Council for University Development Cooperation (VLIR-UOS)
Vlaamse Interuniversitaire Raad voor Universitaire Ontwikkelingssamenwerking (VLIR-UOS)

description.narrative: There is a longstanding history of cooperation between Vietnam and Flemish higher education institutions. After nearly 20 years of successful cooperation, Vietnam continues to be a key partner country in the VLIR-UOS portfolio. VLIR-UOS works with several partners in Vietnam and supports long term Institutional programmes (IUC, NETWORK) and departmental thematic projects (TEAM, SI). VLIR-UOS supports interventions that strengthen higher education, research and extension in various domains. All interventions frame within the VLIR-UOS Country Strategy for Vietnam which is aligned with national development and higher education priorities. The strategy is translated into the following main themes: Biosciences for food including food security; Environment and natural resources with Climate Change; Health with specific focus on rural health; Technology development focusing on infrastructure, research and technology transfers. The following crosscutting and transversal themes were identified: institutional capacity development with emphasis on university management; research strengthening including statistics and science & technology; research based education and ICT in education. In the 2017-2021 period, an IUC programme with Hue University, a national Network on Bioscience for Food coordinated by Can Tho University with strong support of Hue University continues. Also 3 TEAM projects and 1 South Initiative astarted as from 2017. A number of new projects for Vietnam will still be selected in the 2017-2021 period.

title.narrative: Vietnamese Higher Education Institutes have been empowered in their role as drivers of change by strengthening their threefold mission of research, education and extension (of new knowledge, applications and services) to society.
Number of training module packages developed through the support of the project
Number of new courses developed through the support of the project
Number of Master students graduated directly supported by the project, contributing to the objectives of the project
Number of articles published in international peer reviewed journals (through the support of the project)
Number of presentations (community related) or extension workshops organised through the support of the project
Number of new or substantially updated Master programmes developed (curriculum) through the support of the project
Number of persons reached by presentations (community related) or extension workshops through the support of the project
Number of articles published in national peer reviewed journals (through the support of the project)

Vietnamese Higher Education Institutes have been empowered in their role as drivers of change by strengthening their threefold mission of research, education and extension (of new knowledge, applications and services) to society (continued).

Number of students or staff enabled in the areas of quality management (internal/external) (research & tech. Transfer policy, quality assurance, scientific writing, statistics for research, academic English, human resources management)
Number of students or staff enabled in the areas of D4D (e-learning, ICT backbone/tools/services, library and information services) e-learning development
Number of PhD students graduated directly supported by the project, contributing to the objectives of the project
